text: hello :slightly_smiling_face: and if your `local` server has it's own CA for tls, you can use `NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0 CLIENT_SECRET="abc123" hs project dev`  (only locally, for sure)

Hello Team :wave: ,
A little question about `HubSpot.fetch()`and the fact that `api/crm-extensibility/execution/internal/v3/proxy`convert all *4xx* errors to *500* , is there s anywhere where that behavior is specified please ? sorry to ask if it has already been answered)
Is that behavior only present when using `hs project dev`  please ?

Hi everyone! I have two questions I 'm hoping someone can help me solve.
1. The Figma design kit shows that the 'Alert' component can be multi-line, but I don't see that as an option in the component documentation. What property should I be using to achieve the multi-line effect?
2. I'm familiar with the `onCrmPropertiesUpdate` and `refreshObjectProperties` actions to trigger a refresh of the card when a property changes, but is there a way to trigger a refresh based on an association? General use case is that we want the card to update automatically when a custom object is associated with a deal. I know we can add a button for the user to refresh the data (which would trigger a query with GraphQL), but is there a way to do it automatically when an association is added? Anyone have any [automated[ workarounds if it's not possible?

`hs project create` is creating a folder but does't containing package.json file

anyone facing same issue?

I have updated latest CLI tools as well
Anyone know how I can get this input component to stretch to meet the search button? I've been trying all sorts of methods with no success :disappointed:

Hey <@UTYRPALSZ> you could try with a custom rollup property on the deal "Number of associated [custom objects]". So each time it increases it means there's a new association and you could refresh the card with that.
I did attempt using box with no luck but maybe I need to give it another shot
Had to play with the flex size a bit but that fixed it! Thanks a million :facepunch:

Is it possible to automatically add a UI extension card to the page layout on the contact record page when a Marketplace app is installed, instead of requiring the user to drag and drop it into the page layout?
